article.description:
With its big man benched, Mississippi
State is relying more on its little guys.

related.description:
The NCAA wants more information from
sidelined Mississippi State center Mario Austin before making a
decision on his eligibility this season, Austin's attorney said
Sunday.
related.linkText: NCAA wants more information about MSU's Austin
related.title: NCAA looking at high school record of MSU star
related.headline: NCAA looking at high school record of MSU star

article.headline: Bowers and Zimmerman help ease the sting of no Austin
article.linkText: Without their big guy, guards come through for No. 23 MSU
article.story: STARKVILLE, Miss. (AP) -- With its big man benched, Mississippi State is relying more on its little guys. Timmy Bowers scored 19 points and fellow 6-foot-2 guard Derrick Zimmerman had 12 points and eight assists as the 23rd-ranked Bulldogs bounced back from a season-opening defeat to beat McNeese State 81-65 Monday night. Mississippi State center Mario Austin, the team's leading scorer and rebounder last season, has been held out of the first two games while the school waits for an NCAA ruling on his eligibility. Without Austin providing points in the paint, the ability of Bowers and Zimmerman to drive to the basket is Mississippi State's best weapon. ''Z and myself, we worked extremely hard this summer on little things. Taking the ball to the hole. Going left. Going right,'' Bowers said. ''We know without Mario it's going to be hard. We've got to get accustomed to playing without him.'' Winsome Frazier, a 6-4 reserve guard, had a career-high 14 points and Michael Ignerski scored all 12 of his points in the second half for the Bulldogs (1-1). Ignerski's putback with 3½ minutes left stretched the lead to 72-52. Ignerski is a 6-10 forward, but he's more comfortable playing on the wing than down low. He knows that has to change without the 6-9 Austin. ''I have to be one of those guys that step up while Mario is out,'' said Ignerski, who also had eight rebounds. Greg Tucker scored 17 points, shooting 4-for-6 from 3-point range, to lead McNeese State (1-1). The Bulldogs, who were knocked off by Louisiana-Lafayette on Saturday, were flat at the start again. They fell behind 11-4 early, and during a timeout Austin got in the face of Marcus Campbell, one of the players filling in for him. Campbell and fellow center Lincoln Smith were only slightly more effective than they were in the opener, when they combined for six points and two rebounds. The two totaled 10 points and eight rebounds Monday night. Slowly, the Bulldogs gained control using their defense to create some easy baskets and their athleticism to drive to the hoop. Mississippi State forced 25 turnovers. ''I think the urgency picked up by all of us,'' Mississippi State coach Rick Stansbury said. ''We've got to have that mentality. We've got to win every possession defensively. This team has to learn that.'' Zimmerman converted one Cowboys giveaway into a dunk that put Mississippi State up 50-40 with just less than 15 minutes left. The Cowboys stayed close thanks to the long-range shooting of Tucker. He sank a 3-pointer with a hand in his face to answer Zimmerman's dunk and make it 50-43. Mississippi State finally shook the Cowboys with a 12-2 run, highlighted by Ignerski's one-handed follow slam, to go up 62-45 with 7:30 left. McNeese State coach Tic Price was ejected in the first half, getting two technicals within seconds for a loud and animated protest of a non-call under the basket. It was the first ejection of Price's career. ''That's something I feel bad about,'' he said. ''I think my adrenaline was going. I deserved what I got.'' An attorney for Austin said he hopes the NCAA will make a decision by the weekend. Mississippi State plays Jacksonville on Saturday. Stansbury isn't so confident Austin's situation will be resolved that soon, especially with Thanksgiving on Thursday. ''Thursday and Friday, I doubt that those guys will work very hard,'' he said, referring to the NCAA committee that is reviewing Austin's high school academic records.
